cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest today, turning north tonight and north-northeast Thursday, skirting the coasts of GA–NC, then accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near the South Carolina / North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear–Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Surf City NC (Storm-Surge); Volusia/Brevard FL line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and north of Savannah River to Surf City NC (Hurricane/Tropical-Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina, with lesser effects possible into the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds late Friday into early Saturday; breezy with gusts 25–35 kt possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected in Baltimore Harbor; minor tidal anomalies possible in lower Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–2 inches; locally higher but totals likely below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches; minor coastal flooding in the lower bay possible.
